definitions: bread made from dough fermented with wild yeast and bacteria cultures
examples: The bakery specializes in authentic sourdough bread
She keeps her sourdough starter alive for years

definitions: person who uses their left hand as their dominant hand
examples: The baseball team recruited a talented southpaw pitcher
Being a southpaw gives him an advantage in boxing

definitions: object kept as a reminder of a place visited or event
examples: She bought a small souvenir from each country
The shop sells tourist souvenirs near the monument

definitions: monarch or supreme ruler of a country or territory
British gold coin worth one pound sterling
examples: The sovereign ruled the kingdom for forty years
Queen Elizabeth II is the sovereign of the United Kingdom
The antique sovereign coin fetched a high price
He collected British sovereigns from the Victorian era

definitions: supreme power or authority of a state to govern itself or another state
examples: The nation fought to maintain its sovereignty
Questions of sovereignty dominate international relations discussions

definitions: adult female pig kept for breeding piglets
examples: The farmer's sow gave birth to twelve piglets
A large sow rooted around in the muddy pen

definitions: plant and its beans used for food products and oil
examples: Many vegetarians rely on soy for protein intake
The restaurant offers soy milk as an alternative

definitions: British term for soybean and products made from it
examples: She ordered her coffee with soya milk instead
The recipe calls for soya sauce and fresh ginger

definitions: edible bean from East Asia widely grown for oil and protein
examples: Farmers rotate corn crops with soybean plantings annually
The United States exports millions of tons of soybeans

definitions: resort with mineral springs or therapeutic water treatments
large bath with jets of warm water for relaxation
examples: They spent the weekend at a luxurious mountain spa
The spa offers massage and aromatherapy treatments
The backyard spa seats six people comfortably
We relaxed in the spa after the workout

definitions: vehicle designed for travel or operation in outer space
examples: The spacecraft orbited Earth for six months continuously
Engineers designed a new spacecraft for Mars exploration

definitions: flight of a vehicle through outer space by rocket propulsion
examples: Commercial spaceflight becomes more affordable each year
The astronaut completed her third spaceflight mission successfully

definitions: man who travels in space as an astronaut
examples: The young boy dreams of becoming a spaceman
The spaceman floated weightlessly inside the space station

definitions: large spacecraft designed to carry people through space
examples: The spaceship launched from Cape Canaveral yesterday morning
Science fiction movies often feature advanced alien spaceships

definitions: pressurized garment worn by astronauts during space activities outside spacecraft
examples: The astronaut checked her spacesuit before the spacewalk
Modern spacesuits cost millions of dollars to manufacture

definitions: arrangement of spaces or gaps between objects, words, or lines
examples: Adjust the spacing between paragraphs for better readability
The spacing of the fence posts needs to be uniform

definitions: tool with flat blade for digging soil or moving material
black suit in playing cards shaped like inverted heart with stem
examples: He used a spade to dig holes for planting
The garden spade has a sharp metal edge
She played the ace of spades to win
The deck was missing the three of spades

definitions: long thin cylindrical pasta made from wheat and water
examples: She cooked spaghetti with tomato sauce for dinner
The restaurant serves authentic Italian spaghetti carbonara daily

definitions: unwanted or unsolicited electronic messages sent in bulk
canned precooked meat product made from pork and ham
examples: Her inbox was flooded with spam every morning
The filter blocks most spam from reaching users
They fried spam with eggs for a quick breakfast
The grocery store stocked several varieties of spam

definitions: full extent or reach between two points in space or time
examples: The bridge has a span of three hundred meters
Her attention span lasted only a few minutes

definitions: synthetic elastic fiber used in stretchable clothing and sportswear
examples: The yoga pants contain twenty percent spandex material
Athletes prefer spandex for its flexibility and comfort

definitions: dog breed with long ears and silky coat originally bred for hunting
examples: Their cocker spaniel loves to play fetch outside
The spaniel wagged its tail enthusiastically at visitors

definitions: act of hitting someone on the buttocks as punishment
examples: The debate over spanking children continues among parents
Some schools have banned spanking as disciplinary action

definitions: British term for tool used to grip and turn nuts or bolts
examples: He grabbed a spanner from the toolbox quickly
The mechanic needed a larger spanner for the job

definitions: strong pole used on ship for sails or rigging
practice session of boxing with controlled punches
examples: The storm damaged the main spar of the sailboat
Sailors secured the spar before the voyage began
The boxers spar three times weekly at the gym
He likes to spar with experienced fighters occasionally

definitions: bright flashing or glittering light from reflected rays
examples: The diamond's sparkle caught everyone's attention immediately
Stars sparkle in the clear night sky above

definitions: quality of having bubbles from carbonation in beverages
examples: She prefers sparkling water to still water daily
The sparkling wine made a perfect toast

definitions: controlled practice boxing or martial arts training between partners
examples: Regular sparring improves a fighter's reflexes and timing
The gym scheduled sparring sessions every Tuesday evening

definitions: small brown bird common in many parts of the world
examples: A sparrow built its nest under the roof
Sparrows chirped loudly in the garden every morning

definitions: sudden involuntary contraction of muscles causing pain or twitching
examples: The runner experienced a painful spasm in her calf
Back spasms kept him awake throughout the night

definitions: brief petty quarrel or disagreement between people
examples: The couple had a spat over dinner plans
Their political spat lasted only a few minutes

definitions: sudden large number or amount of similar things happening
examples: A spate of burglaries worried the neighborhood residents
The company faced a spate of customer complaints

definitions: broad flat utensil used for lifting or spreading food
examples: She flipped pancakes with a metal spatula carefully
The rubber spatula scraped the bowl clean completely

definitions: eggs laid by fish or amphibians in water
product or result generated from something else
examples: Salmon return upstream to lay their spawn annually
The pond was full of frog spawn in spring
The movie spawned several successful sequels and merchandise
His invention would spawn an entire new industry

definitions: illicit establishment selling alcoholic beverages especially during Prohibition era in America
examples: The old speakeasy operated behind a flower shop
Modern bars recreate the speakeasy atmosphere with hidden entrances

definitions: action or skill of conveying information or expressing thoughts in speech
examples: Public speaking terrifies many people more than death
Her speaking voice carries well across large rooms

definitions: weapon with long shaft and pointed tip for thrusting or throwing
examples: Ancient warriors hunted with spears and arrows
The museum displayed ceremonial spears from various cultures

definitions: sharp pointed tip of a spear weapon
person or group leading an attack or movement
examples: The bronze spearhead dates from the Iron Age
Archaeologists found several spearheads at the site
She will spearhead the new marketing campaign initiative
The general served as spearhead of the invasion

definitions: detailed description of design and materials for something
examples: The engineer reviewed the spec before starting construction
They built the house according to the architect's specs

definitions: British spelling for concentration on particular area of activity or knowledge
examples: Her specialisation in cardiac surgery took years
The university offers specialisation in marine biology programs

definitions: particular area of knowledge or skill that someone has specialized in
examples: His specialism in tax law proved very valuable
The hospital recruited doctors with different specialisms carefully

definitions: product or service for which person or place is particularly known
British term for particular area of professional expertise
examples: The restaurant's speciality is fresh seafood pasta dishes
Try their speciality coffee blend from Colombia
Her medical speciality focuses on pediatric neurology treatment
Each chef brings their own speciality to the kitchen

definitions: concentration on particular area of activity, study, or professional knowledge
examples: Medical specialization requires years of additional training
The company's specialization in software security attracted investors

definitions: product or service for which person or place is particularly known
particular area of professional knowledge or skill
examples: The bakery's specialty is chocolate croissants made fresh
Ask about today's specialty at the restaurant
His medical specialty involves treating rare genetic disorders
She chose emergency medicine as her specialty field

definitions: detailed description of design, materials, and workmanship for something to be built or manufactured
examples: The product specification lists all technical requirements clearly
Contractors must follow the specification exactly during construction

definitions: quality of being clearly defined or identified with exact detail and accuracy
examples: The test's specificity helps eliminate false positive results
Scientific writing requires specificity in describing experimental methods

definitions: very small spot or particle of something
examples: A speck of dust floated through the sunbeam
She noticed a speck on her clean white shirt

definitions: small spot or patch of color different from the background
examples: The bird's eggs had brown speckles on white
Speckles of paint dotted the artist's studio floor
